artist: Unknown artist (Italian, 16th century); Formerly attributed to Rosso Fiorentino or his circle
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back, in blue ink: [Maria Shire Lelia Mendez de Beruascour / 1977]; on back, in pencil: [Rosso Fiorentino / or his circle: Leonard Thiry?]
life_date: Unknown artist (Italian, 16th century); Formerly attributed to Rosso Fiorentino or his circle, Italian (Florence), 1494–1540
medium: Pen and brown ink, brown wash on cream laid paper
provenance: Carlo Prayer, Lugt 2044 (1826-1900), Milan; Juan (d. 1920) and Felix (d. 1914) Bernasconi, Milan, Lugano, and Argentina; by descent to Maria Bernasconi (in 1977); Bernasconi sale, Christie's, London, July 5, 1988, part of no. 195, as anonymous, by a Lombard hand, for £724.75, to Moir; Prof. Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara, 1988-2006; gave to MIA
title: Moses Striking the Rock and Bringing Forth Water
